title: Is the Calculus 3rd edition by Michael Spivak a good book to learn calculus? - Quora

response.answer_text: Spivak's calculus is a great text to read after you already know calculus and want to get in-depth with the theory of everything. It's a terrible choice though if you're just learning the subject for the first time. The exercises are often extremely challenging to the point of being unsolvable by many students working alone. You need a gentler introduction to calculus. I would say get “calculus made easy” by Sylvanus Thompson. Then go for Serge Lang's “Short Calculus” followed by his “A Second Course in Calculus.” At this point you would be ready to give Spivak's text a try.

If you want to see the elegant and beauty of math, and willing to invest your time and effort then it is the best choice (Apostol’s books are more comprehensive but in my opinion, Spivak’s book have more beautiful exercises, but you can’t go wrong with any of them). There is not much difference between 3rd and 4th edition, so the answer is YES!
